understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is related to a method called journal() which returns a Journal object. The method checks a boolean variable _transientMode and based on its value, it either creates a TransientJournal object or a PersistentJournal object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuring the type of Journal object to be used based on the value of _transientMode. If _transientMode is true, a TransientJournal object is created, otherwise a PersistentJournal object is created with specific configurations like journal size threshold, age threshold, disk sync, journal suffix, and monitor.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _journalSizeThreshold configuration is used as a parameter when creating a PersistentJournal object in the journal() method. It is passed to the PersistentJournal constructor along with other parameters.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the _journalSizeThreshold configuration depends on how often the journal() method is called in the system. If the journal() method is called frequently, then the _journalSizeThreshold configuration will also be triggered frequently.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _journalSizeThreshold configuration option on the system is significant as it determines the size threshold for the journal. This threshold affects how much data can be stored in the journal before it needs to be archived or cleared, which can impact system performance and storage usage.
